column2: PENNSYLVANIA DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column6: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column8: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column10: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.

column2: 2. The blood alcohol content (BAC) for drivers under 21 to be charged with driving under the influence is:
3. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the right.
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 4. Speed limit signs are:
5. This sign means:
6. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
7. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.

column2: 8. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column6: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column8: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column10: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.

column2: 9. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 10. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, you should:
column8: look towards the left side of the road.

column2: 11. Your BAC depends on:
column6: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 12. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: You must pass the school bus.
column6: The bus is about to stop.
column8: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column10: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 13. Yellow traffic signs:
column8: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 14. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column8: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.
column10: The last driver to reach the intersection.

column2: 15. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column6: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column8: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column10: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 16. Guide signs are:
17. This road sign means:
18. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column6: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.
